He did not set himself up as a judge of right and wrong,
and he found his place among the common crowd.

[What is called] "There is Nothing":
Look at it; you doe not see its form:
listen to it; you do not hear its sound.
Reach for it, and you cannot grasp it.
gaze at it, and you cannot fathom it.
Collected and fused,
floodlike and expansive.
It is something whose brilliance cannot be penetrated by any instrument.

Encloses Heaven and Earth,
smelts the myriad things,
greatly penetrates the chaotic and obscure.
Deeply impenetrable, vast and great,
it can have no exterior.
as fine as the tip of a hair, as sharp as a point,
it can have no interior.
